channel.title: Problem with Port Forwarding [Added Pictures]
channel.description:
[size=14pt]Hello, I've been trying to make a RS2 Private server, I followed a tutorial on Youtube:[/size] [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jd9D1ewUgS4&feature=related]Part 1[/url] - [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F5Z0tx4Yoq4&feature=channel]Part 2[/url]
I followed all instruction's, I used PimpScape as source, but now I need to Port Forward, in the video he goes to his ip and there is just a button with Port Forwarding, but I don't have something saying Port Forwarding, here is a picture of how my IP-"Control base" (Don't know how to call it) looks like: [img]http://files.uploadffs.com/5/15115734/ZyXEL.bmp[/img]
If anyone could help me with this I would be very thankfull, if you need more information, just ask it, I can also add more pictures if u need!
My router is a: Prestige 650R-31[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 15, 2009, 05:14:45 am[/size][hr]*BUMP*
Somebody respond please :(

item.title: Problem with Port Forwarding [Added Pictures]
item.dc:creator: @timmers4 timmers4
item.description:
@timmers4 wrote:

Could anyone help me, you can use a program called TeamViewer 3, then you can take a look inside my computer, and see everything, making these pictures and all takes so long…

TeamViewer 3 can be downloaded here: http://www.teamviewer.com

When you have TeamViewer downloaded, pm me please.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with Port Forwarding [Added Pictures]
item.dc:creator: @X_Val_X X Val X
item.description:
@X_Val_X wrote:

If the IPConfig is not recognisable
Right click on ‘Command Prompt’ then click ‘Run as Administrator’
that will allow the Ipconfig to be recognised.

Hope I helped if you still needed help with that problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with Port Forwarding [Added Pictures]
item.dc:creator: @timmers4 timmers4
item.description:
@timmers4 wrote:

It doesn’t work, atleast I don’t know where to enter my ip and port?

also I have found like 2 different ip’s, but I don’t know wich 1 I should use, and I don’t see how no-ip and my basic source are connected?

Read full topic

item.description:
@timmers4 wrote:

Ok, I also found a tutorial on google (finally) it shows me this:

Is that good?

Well I’m trying your solution now, Aintaro!

Wish me luck

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with Port Forwarding [Added Pictures]
item.dc:creator: @Aintaro Aintaro
item.description:
@Aintaro wrote:

well if u got a LAN connection u would have to go to :

  • advanced settings
  • LAN
    -Then u would have to enter ur ip
    -Then u would see port: enter 43594 in it
    -Public port ur ip to let ppl go trough.

Then save settings and use no-ip and ur server should be online.

No idea what ur ip is? go to google.com and type in :

myip

Then u would see ur ip.

Thanks for reading.

Aintaro

Read full topic

ipconfig does not become recognise as an internal or external task, programme or batch file.

item.title: Problem with Port Forwarding [Added Pictures]
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

I don’t think there’s a place for port forwarding questions. Go to Start > Run > CMD > Enter > Ipconfig > Enter. PM me a screenshot.

item.title: Problem with Port Forwarding [Added Pictures]

item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

I’m only responding because you’re one of the few that actually use proper grammar. I am guessing you haven’t configured your static IP.

Also, we don’t help with port forwarding questions here.
